column9: 3.13 Improve resilience in the face of flooding and coastal change risks
column16: 3.13.iv Improve our national capability to respond to a major flood emergency, based on lessons from March 2011 Exercise Watermark
column17:
In October 2011, the report into the findings of Exercise Watermark – Britain’s biggest ever civil emergency exercise – was published. The report included 36 recommendations to improve our preparedness for managing flooding.

The Government is implementing the findings of this report and the 36 recommendations. A final report on progress will be published by Defra in July.

column5: 4. Pensions reform
column7: Provide decent State Pensions, encourage employers to provide high quality pensions and make automatic enrolment and higher pension saving a reality. Phase out the default retirement age to allow more flexibility around retirement
column9: 4.1 Change the State Pension system to help ensure that it is sustainable and fair between generations
column16: 4.1.i Publish a White Paper on a single tier pension for future pensioners
column17: The Government is committed to introducing a simpler single tier pension for future pensioners to better support saving for retirement. Given the importance of these reforms we are continuing to work on the policy to ensure we get it right. We will publish a white paper as soon as possible.

column5: 1. Deliver a more focused and effective tax administration
column7:
Create a tax administration that is more efficient, flexible and effective by using our customer- centric approach to transform the way we deliver services, manage contact and deal with compliance related issues
• Use our understanding of customers to target resources to the areas of greatest risk, investing £917m to tackle avoidance and evasion, attacks on our systems by organised criminals and improve our methods of debt collection capacity. This will bring in an estimated £7bn a year in additional revenues by 2014-15
• Transform PAYE through the use of real-time information in order to bring service improvements to employers and taxpayers and support the introduction of the Universal Credit
column9: 1.1 Invest £917m to bring in £7bn in additional tax revenues per annum by 2014-15, as we: (a) tackle avoidance and evasion through targeted campaigns and interventions; (b) take specific action to tackle off-shore avoidance and evasion; (c) prevent tax avoidance before it happens; (d) tackle organised criminals and fraud; and (e) improve our debt collection capability
column16: 1.1.i. Launch an additional 20 taskforces each year focusing on rule breakers

This will bring in an estimated £7bn a year in additional revenues by 2014-15
• Transform PAYE through the use of real-time information in order to bring service improvements to employers and taxpayers and support the introduction of the Universal Credit

column17: Implementation of the regulations has been dependent upon the Parliamentary business timetable. The Commons Delegated Legislation Committee considered the draft regulations on 21June and they are due to be debated by the House of Lords in July.  Subject to affirmative resolution of both Houses the regulations are expected to come into force later in July 2012.

column7: Reform the legal aid system to make it work more efficiently, while ensuring that we provide necessary support for those who need it most and for those cases that require it.
